alert.note: Alert for Fergus (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 5:09PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Fergus County through 600 PM MDT... At 508 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles south of Lewistown, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Moore, Grass Range, Forestgrove, Glengarry, Heath, Buffalo and Garneill. This includes the following highways... Highway 200 between mile markers 65 and 71, between mile markers 88 and 89, and between mile markers 92 and 123. Highway 191 between mile markers 27 and 52. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for central Montana.
